item.title: Ways to reduce JVM Docker image size
item.description: This blog post focuses on optimizing the size of JVM Docker images. It explores various techniques such as multi-stage builds, jlink, jdeps, and experimenting with base images. By implementing these optimizations, deployments can be faster and resource usage can be optimized. The problem Since Java 11, there is no pre-bundled JRE provided. As a result, basic Dockerfiles without any optimization can result in large image sizes. In the absence of a provided JRE, it becomes necessary to explore techniques and optimizations to reduce the size of JVM Docker images.

item.title: Class Loaders in JVM: An Overview
item.description: Class loaders are an essential part of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM), but many developers consider them to be mysterious.
